Reason: The configuration _journalAgeThreshold is performance-sensitive. This is because the _journalAgeThreshold configuration directly affects the behavior of the PersistentJournal constructor, which is a performance-related operation. The value set for _journalAgeThreshold determines how long entries are kept in the journal before they are considered old and potentially removed, impacting the size of the journal and the performance of the system. Therefore, any changes in _journalAgeThreshold can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
